column4: goodevening all. currently booted off the live cd on my living room computer, evaluating ubuntu for use on my TV
i'm having visual tearing and stuttering issues playing back full screen video content
the graphics card is fairly recent (but not cutting edge) nvidia. does the live-cd load all nvidia stuff?
if so, what are my options? if not, will installing fully give me accelerated video?
no, it starts up with opensource noveau driver
are you saying just on the live-cd?

on livecd and when u initially install ubuntu it defaults to opensource driver, if your card is supported by ubuntu it'll prompt you to install a proprietary nvidia driver, if its not you can always get the driver from nvidia.com, heres instructions to install it manually from nvidia.com https://help.ubuntu.com/community/NvidiaManual
awesome. just wanted to ensure i'd have smooth as butter playback on my HD tv
what resolution?
agh, i forget exact WxH. its 720p
i'm connecting via a DVI to HDMI cable
shouldnt be any problems, nvidia is usually pretty good at detecting resolutions, got pretty nonstandard 1360x768 detected out of the box
awesome. hows video playback under ubuntu? i've never used it for HD playback
with a powerful graphics card and cpu you shouldnt have any problems. although i dont think bluerays are supported
i'm not doing bluray disks, but am playing back 1080 HD mpeg4 files. its a core 2 duo with a nice nvidia and 2gb ram. should be ok i'm guessing
yea you should be fine, take a look at extra codecs though
thanks
yes you can
get unetbootin, it even has a windows version
i'm on a mac :/
p3s are still great!
im in the resale business
